sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
message_1:
Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. 

Find (A x B) ∩ {1} and {1} ∩ (A x B). 

Show that the intersection of the Cartesian product of A and B with the set {1} is not the same as the intersection of the set {1} with the Cartesian product of A and B.
